item.description:
I'm planning to do the Tripyramids and Sleepers on  Saturday, July 9th.  Two of the Tripyramids are 4,000 footers  - East Sleeper is a New England 100 peak.   

This will be a moderately paced hike -   I'm not a fast hiker but I do keep moving and average about book time these days.

We will take the Pine Bend trail from Route 112 (Kancamagus Highway) up to North Tripyramid.  We will then use the Mt. Tripyramid Trail to cross Middle and South Tripyramid and take the Kate Sleeper trail over East and West Sleeper.  We will descend via Downes Brook Trail, also on the Kanc.   If the weather has recently been WET or if it is rainy that day, we will NOT be doing the slide(s) and will alter our route accordingly. 

Because of the distance, time and number of peaks involved (13.1 miles in about 10 hours crossing 5 peaks) please demonstrate (via the RSVP questions) that you have been hiking similar distances and terrain recently.

My hikes are always dog-friendly.  However, make sure to bring extra water for the dogs and know that we will likely encounter one slide, which can be difficult for dogs.  I will have both dogs with me - they need these peaks too!

---------

Be prepared for cold and potentially poor weather conditions.  DO NOT WEAR COTTON OR DENIM. This is dangerous in cool/wet weather. If you have questions about how to prepare or how to dress, ask them in advance.

Answers to FAQs 

  • This is a traverse, so we WILL have to carp ool.    We will meet in the lot of the Downes Brook Trail head and carpool up the Kancamagus to the Pine Bend Brook trail head at 8:30am.
  • This route AVOIDS the North Slide.
  • Sunset on Saturday will be at 8:29 pm. 
  • Headlamps are not required, but strongly suggested as a safety precaution.  Always be prepared to come out in the dark if necessary.
  • Bring plenty of water - there are some non-potable water sources along the way.
  •  This hike is not very exposed, except on the southern slide portion.
  • We will not pass a shelter or a hut on this hike.
  • We will START AND FINISH TOGETHER. If you cannot hold your speed down to match that of the group (if necessary), this is not the hike for you.  I require that hikers in my group wait at trail junctions and at summits to allow the group to make decisions and reset their pace along the way.
  • I (Kate) am not a speedy hiker, but I do keep a steady pace.
  • If the conditions are prohibitive, I have no qualms about turning around. The mountain will be there another day.  I want you to be around for another day too.
  • I watch the weather carefully and post weather updates during the week leading up to the hike. I rely on NOAA and MWObs for my forecasts.
  • This summer, I am scheduling most of my hikes on Saturdays.  Rain dates will be on Sundays, provided the weather is expected to improve.
  • I will provide attendees with my cell phone number in advance of the hike.

Most of the payoff comes in the form of fabulous views and enjoying the outdoors so, if the weather looks like it will be miserable, we will reschedule. Please plan accordingly.

RSVP Questions are NOT optional - I may delete your 'going' RSVP and/or will not take you from the waiting list if I don't see your answers.   If you do not provide me with a phone number to try and contact you on the morning/evening of the hike (if necessary), we will NOT wait for you at the trailhead.

 

Book time is about  13.1 miles,  9hrs  & 50 minutes

DISCLAIMER: MY ROLE AS ORGANIZER IN THIS HIKE IS SOCIAL. I AM NOT TRAINED TO BE A GUIDE, NOR HAVE I RECEIVED TRAINING OR INSTRUCTION IN HIKING SAFETY, WINTER HIKING OR MOUNTAIN RESCUE. WHILE I TRY TO HEAD OFF SOME OF THE PROBLEMS I HAVE SEEN (OR EXPERIENCED OR EVEN CAUSED) IN THE PAST, MY UNDERSTANDING IS THAT YOU WILL TAKE RESPONSIBILITY FOR YOUR OWN SAFETY. IF MY DISAPPEARANCE DURING THIS TRIP WOULD CAUSE YOU MORE THAN ANNOYANCE AND INCONVENIENCE, THIS IS NOT THE TRIP FOR YOU. THERE ARE ALWAYS RISKS IN HIKING IN THE MOUNTAINS. IF YOU ARE NOT CONFIDENT THAT YOU UNDERSTAND THE RISKS, PLEASE DO NOT SIGN UP (or change your RSVP to no). I HAVE NOT CLIMBED THESE PEAKS BEFORE AND HAVE DONE ALL MY RESEARCH VIA GUIDEBOOKS, INTERNET AND ADVICE FROM OTHER HIKERS, SO IT IS POSSIBLE THAT SOME INFORMATION IS NOT ACCURATE. I AM PERFECTLY CAPABLE OF MAKING STUPID OR MINDLESS MISTAKES, SO PLEASE DO YOUR OWN RESEARCH AND COME PREPARED WITH APPROPRIATE KNOWLEDGE, EQUIPMENT AND JUDGMENT.
